recipe.title: Cookbook:Broccoli Salad
recipe.description: This broccoli salad is often served at potlucks. == Ingredients == * 7–8 cups (700–800 g / 1.5–1.8 lb) broccoli florets * 7–8 slices of crisp fried bacon, crumbled (smoked bacon works well) * 1 red or sweet onion, chopped (Vidalia are recommended) * 1 apple, chopped (optional) * 1 cup (80 g / 2.8 oz) raisins, plumped in boiling water * 1 cup (250 g / 8.8 oz) mayonnaise * ½ cup (110 g / 3.9 oz) granulated sugar (or equivalent artificial sweetener) * ½ cup (40 g / 1.4 oz) pecans or sunflower seeds * dash of cider vinegar or lemon juice
ingredients: 7–8 slices of crisp fried bacon, crumbled (smoked bacon works well)
1 red or sweet onion, chopped (Vidalia are recommended)
1 cup (80 g / 2.8 oz) raisins, plumped in boiling water
½ cup (110 g / 3.9 oz) granulated sugar (or equivalent artificial sweetener)
½ cup (40 g / 1.4 oz) pecans or sunflower seeds
dash of cider vinegar or lemon juice
instructions: Whisk mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar together.s
Mix remaining ingredients and combine completely in a large bowl.
Cool in the refrigerator overnight before serving.
notes: May be served with additional pecans or sunflower seeds sprinkled over the top.
2 bunches of broccoli should supply enough florets. If not, then add stems and stalk (peeled and chopped finely).

metadata.description: Broccoli salad served at a Minnesota pot luck supper. Made with raw broccoli and chopped red onion, crumbled fried bacon, plumped raisins, mayonnaise, sugar, and vinegar.
